text: H thurh Gode gefu Aenglelandes kyning griete aelle biscopes and ealle mine eorles and mine scirgerevan and thegenes, Fraencisce and Aenglisce on tham sciran the Willelm ærcebiscop and se hired æt Christes circean on Cantrareberig habbath land in freondlice.

And ic kithe eow that ic habbe heom geunnon thet hi beon æle ther land wurde the hi hæfdon on Eodwordes kynges dæge, mines mæges, and on Willelmes kynges dæge, mines faeder, and saca and socne on strande and on streame, on wudon and on felden, tolnes and teames, grithbreces and hamsocne, forstealles and infangenestheoves and flæmene feormithe over hire mænn, bunan burgan and butan, swa full and swa forth swa mine ægene wicneres hit secan scoldan and over swa fela thegenas swa ic heom to gelætan habbæ.
And ic nelle thet ænig man ænig thing her on tyo buton hi and hera wicneres the hi hit betaecan willath, ne Fransice ne Aenglise.
Forthan thingan the ic habbe Crist thas gerithae forgyvon mine swale to ecere alysadnesse ealswa Eodward kyng and mine faedor aer haefdon.
And ic nelle gethavian thet aenig man this to brece be minen fullan freondscipe.
